text: Madura Kulatunga (; born March 23, 1980) is a Sri Lankan software engineer and the founder of Madura English–Sinhala Dictionary. == Early life == Kulatunga studied at Royal College, Colombo 7 and earn his Master of Science in Information Technology degree in Sikkim Manipal University. He is a Microsoft Certified Systems Engineer. == Career == Kulatunga saw an opportunity to transform the printed English-Sinhala dictionaries, which was difficult to use. He decided to create an electronic English-Sinhala dictionary. Then he went on to develop the Madura English–Sinhala Dictionary computer software which has popular in Sri Lanka. He was the founder of the world's first online English-Sinhala dictionary. == References == == Other websites == Category:1980 births Category:Living people Category:Software engineers Category:Sri Lankan scientists
title: Madura Kulatunga
